intro: Uapaca perrotii, commonly known as the African cherry or wild mango, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by bright red, fleshy fruits that are edible. Its fruits are rich in nutrients and have been used traditionally for food and medicinal purposes. The plant also plays an important role in local ecosystems and biodiversity.
